snippet: The index provider’s decision to once again postpone the inclusion of mainland stocks in its influential benchmark reflected continuing concerns over Chinese government intervention.
abstract: MSCI announces that it will again decline to add Chinese stocks to its influential emerging-markets benchmark; decision is blow to Chinese government and Chinese investors, and demonstrates how long courtship was undone by market crash and other factors.

byline.original: By NEIL GOUGH and LANDON THOMAS Jr
byline.contributor: Neil Gough reported from Shanghai and Landon Thomas Jr. from New York.

lead_paragraph: The index provider’s decision to once again postpone the inclusion of mainland stocks in its influential benchmark reflected continuing concerns over Chinese government intervention.

headline.main: MSCI Delays Adding China Stock to Emerging Markets Benchmark
headline.print_headline: China Again Is Blocked  From Stock Benchmark
